notes: On 2 June 2020, two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Paltao, Pulilan, Bulacan. Police said that the two slain suspects were known members of a drug group and that sachets of shabu (crystal meth) were recovered from them during the operation.

On 2 June 2020, four police officers were unhurt after suspected NPA militants detonated a bomb between Barangay Mandaing and Barangay Anlogan in Cabanglasan, Bukidnon as the police were arriving in their patrol car. The police officers then fired at the suspected militants, who reportedly fled. The police were en route to Barangay Cabulohan, the site of a grenade attack suspected to have been carried out by the militants the day before. There were no reported NPA casualties.

On 3 June 2020, a key witness in the trial on the 2009 Ampatuan Massacre, who was also acquitted in December 2019, was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Tantangan, South Cotabato. The witness is under the government's Witness Protection Program and was with a police security escort and a driver. The security escort fired back at the assailants, who then fled. The security escort later died, while the driver was severely wounded. The masterminds of the 2009 Ampatuan Massacre - including key members of the Ampatuan family - as well as around 40 others were convicted for crimes related to the massacre in December 2019.

source: ABS CBN; Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Sunstar (Philippines); GMA News; Rappler; Manila Bulletin; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 3 June 2020, the mayor of Lumbaca-Unayan, Lanao del Sur and his entourage were attacked by unidentified assailants in Barangay Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental. notes: On 17 June 2020, a barangay captain was shot dead while a barangay councilor was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay 384, Quiapo, Manila. Police said the attack might be related to politics or to business.

On 18 June 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Luklukan Sur, Jose Panganiban, Camarines Norte. Police said they recovered 12 sachets of shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

On 18 June 2020, a Muslim broadcaster who hosted a religious program on a radio station was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Pasalobong, Zamboanga City, Zamboanga del Sur. The motive for the attack was unclear.

On 18 June 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Bonot, Legazpi, Albay. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect, who they said was on the city's drug watchlist and had previously been arrested on drug charges.

source: Abante; Philippine Daily Inquirer; ABS CBN
notes: On 18 June 2020, a barangay captain was shot dead by unidentified motorcycle-riding assailants in Barangay Longos, Kalayaan, Laguna. The motive for the attack was unclear.

assoc_actor_2: Former Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: On 18 June 2020, a former auxiliary of the military's Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Tagbak, Iloilo City, Iloilo. The motive for the attack was unclear.

source: Abante; Cebu Daily News; GMA News; ABS CBN; Rappler
notes: On 18 June 2020, five suspected NPA militants were killed during a 30-minue firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Luyang, Mabinay, Negros Oriental. The military reported no casualties and said they retrieved weapons and other items from the rebels.

source: Manila Bulletin; ABS CBN; Manila Times
notes: On 19 June 2020, a barangay captain was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay 151, Caloocan. The motive for the attack was unclear.

On 19 June 2020, students of the Polytechnic University of the Philippines (PUP), led by student group United PUP, staged a demonstration against the Anti-Terrorism Bill in front of the PUP campus in Santa Mesa, Manila. Police reportedly harassed the students and prohibited them from demonstrating, taking down the protest banners put up by the students. The Anti-Terrorism Bill's opponents claim that the resulting law will be used to target activists, exacerbate red-tagging and quash legitimate dissent. [size=no report]
On 19 June 2020, a barangay captain was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Dammang East, Echague, Isabela. The motive for the attack was unclear.
On 19 June 2020, the military recovered and defused an improvised bomb planted by suspected Abu Sayyaf militants in Barangay Bohe-Pahuh, Ungkaya Pukan, Basilan.

source: Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Philippine News Agency
notes: On 20 June 2020, suspected NPA militants carried out an arson attack on a quarry site in Barangay Sinabuagan, Valencia, Bukidnon. The militants reportedly burned and destroyed several equipment, including payloaders, a dump truck, a backhoe, and a mini dump truck.

assoc_actor_2: KMP: Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas; Farmers (Philippines); Government of the Philippines (2016-)
source: Philippine Star; Bulatlat; ABS CBN; Panay News
notes: On 20 June 2020, two farmers and barangay officials - a councilor and a youth council chairperson - were shot dead by suspected military elements in Barangay Mayang, Tubungan, Iloilo. The slain barangay councilor is also an organizer of the Federation of Iloilo Farmers Association (FIFA), which is affiliated with the regional chapter of Kilusang Magbubukid ng Pilipinas (KMP) in Panay. KMP is often red-tagged by state forces. The military, however, denied any connection to the attack, and instead pinned it on the NPA, saying the slain councilor was a former rebel.

assoc_actor_2: LFS: League of Filipino Students; Farmers (Philippines); Students (Philippines)
source: Manila Bulletin; Bulatlat; Philippine News Agency; Philippine Daily Inquirer; GMA News
notes: On 20 June 2020, two farmers accused by state security forces of being NPA fighters were killed, while three others were injured, in a 'strafing' attack on a private residence by a joint police and military team in Barangay Bagacay, Palapag, Northern Samar. State security forces asserted that the slain civilians were NPA fighters. However, the government's independent Commission on Human Rights condemned the incident and asserted that the fatalities were civilians, noting that a student activist from the League of Filipino Students, which is often red-tagged by state forces, lives in the strafed residence and is among the wounded.

On 21 June 2020, two members of the Muloc crime group, which police said is known to have direct ties to the Abu Sayyaf, were killed in a firefight with the police in Barangay Candelaria, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

On 21 June 2020, a member of the MILF was wounded in a gunfight with MNLF militants in Barangay Makaguiling, Sultan Kudarat, Maguindanao. The MILF and the MNLF both have peace agreements with the Philippine government.

source: Abante; ABS CBN; GMA News; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 21 June 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a shootout with the police in Barangay Baclaran, Paranaque. One police officer was killed while another was wounded during the shootout. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

source: Philippine Star; Sunstar (Philippines); ABS CBN; Manila Bulletin
notes: On 22 June 2020, a government soldier was killed while nine others were wounded during a two-hour firefight between the Abu Sayyaf and the military in Barangay Pansul, Patikul, Sulu. There was an unknown number of Abu Sayyaf casualties, with the military reporting that it saw bloodstains in the area where the Abu Sayyaf militants were holed up before withdrawing.

On 22 June 2020, an official of the National Irrigation Authority was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Mother Rosary Heights, Cotabato City, Maguindanao. The motive for the attack was unclear.
On 22 June 2020, the Abu Sayyaf and the military engaged in a firefight in Barangay Panglayahan, Patikul, Sulu. There were no reported casualties on either side during this firefight.

On 22 June 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in gun battles in the vicinity of Valencia, Bukidnon, as the military launched pursuit operations against NPA militants suspected of committing an arson attacks in Barangay Sinabuagan of the same city on 20 June. There were no reported casualties on either side, though the military reported retrieving several weapons and other items.

On 22 June 2020, 30 activists led by BAYAN Central Luzon staged a demonstration against the Anti-Terrorism Bill at the Nepo Quadrangle in Angeles, Pampanga. The bill's opponents claim that the resulting law will be used to target activists, exacerbate red-tagging and quash legitimate dissent. The demonstration was immediately stopped by police, who said the demonstrators had no permit to rally. [size=30]

source: ABS CBN; Philippine Star; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 22 June 2020, the mayor of South Upi, Maguindanao survived an explosion from a bomb detonated by unidentified assailants as the mayor's vehicle passed by Barangay Romangaob, South Upi, Maguindanao.

On 23 June 2020, the military discovered a suspected NPA bomb depot in Barangay Maasin, Esperanza, Agusan del Sur, following tips from locals, and recovered several weapons, explosives, and bomb-making materials, including anti-personnel and anti-tank mines.
On 23 June 2020, two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Barangay Tabon-tabon, Daraga, Albay. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspects.
On 23 June 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Pagaspas, Tanauan, Batangas. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

On 23 June 2020, a drug suspect was killed while 14 others were arrested during a police raid in Barangay Niog 1, Bacoor, Cavite. Police said the slain suspect was on their drug watchlist. Police also said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) during the operation.

source: ABS CBN; Abante; GMA News; Tempo (Philippines)
notes: On 24 June 2020, a police officer was killed while three others were wounded in a 20-minute firefight between NPA militants and the police in Barangay San Isidro, Jovellar, Albay. The police were on patrol in the said area.
On 24 June 2020, a police officer was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Bayanan, Bacoor, Cavite. The police officer was already off-duty and on his way home when he was attacked.
On 24 June 2020, a barangay councilor was shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay Nagbinlod, Santa Catalina, Negros Oriental. The motive for the attack was unclear.

On 24 June 2020, a police officer was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Poblacion, San Enrique, Negros Occidental. The motive for the attack was unclear. The police officer was transacting business in a pawnshop when attacked and is assumed off-duty.
On 24 June 2020, two barangay officials - a councilor and a treasurer - were shot dead by unidentified assailants in Barangay San Isidro, Jovellar, Albay. The motive for the attack was unclear.
On 25 June 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Batu-batu, Panglima Sugala, Tawi-Tawi. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

On 25 June 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a 30-minute firefight near the boundary of Barangays Napalico and Sumalili in Arakan, Cotabato. Government soldiers also had air support from military helicopters. There were no reported military casualties, while there was an unknown number of NPA casualties, with the military saying it saw bloodstains in the clash site.
On 25 June 2020, around 200 residents of Barangays Napalico and Sumalili in Arakan, Cotabato, evacuated from the said villages amid fighting between the NPA and the military.
On 25 June 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Kaong, Silang, Cavite. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) during the operation.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
source: ABS CBN; Philippine Daily Inquirer; GMA News; Abante
notes: On 25 June 2020, three drug and kidnapping suspects (one a former police officer who went AWOL) were killed during a police raid in Barangay Behia, Tiaong, Quezon. The raid was mainly an anti-kidnapping operation, though police said they also recovered shabu (crystal meth) and drug paraphernalia from the suspects.

assoc_actor_1: Government of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 25 June 2020, residents of barangays Santa Rosa, Amayco and Pandanon Silos in Murcia, Negros Occidental demonstrated in Murcia town to call for peace and to condemn the Communist Party of the Philippines and the New People's Army. Barangay officials and the military were involved in the event. [size=no report]

On 26 June 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a 10-minute firefight in Barangay Bayawahan, Sevilla, Bohol. There were no reported casualties on either side, though the military reported retrieving weapons from the rebels.

source: CNN; Rappler; Manila Times; ABS CBN
notes: On 26 June 2020, a married couple suspected by police to be the financial conduits of Dawlah Islamiyah, and who also reportedly had ties to both the Abu Sayyaf and the Islamic State, were shot dead by the military in an operation in Better Living Subdivision, Paranaque. Two other individuals, who police also suspected to be ISIS-linked, were also killed. Police said they recovered weapons and Islamic State paraphernalia during the operation.

The demonstrators also condemned the Anti-Terrorism Bill, which they said would result in a law that will be used to target activists, exacerbate red-tagging and quash legitimate dissent. The police dispersed the demonstration and arrested 20, saying they violated COVID-19 quarantine measures. The arrests were widely condemned. [size=around 20]
On 26 June 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Pallocan East, Batangas City, Batangas. Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect.

notes: On 26 June 2020, two auxiliaries of the military's Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) were wounded during an encounter with suspected NPA militants in Barangay Kalilangan, Iligan, Lanao del Norte.

Around 27 June 2020, a provincial board member was killed by unidentified assailants at his home in Barangay Tabing Dagat, Odiongan, Romblon. He was last seen on 26 June and his body was found on 27 June. The motive for the attack was unclear.
On 27 June 2020, a government soldier was killed during a two-hour firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Kalilangan, Iligan, Lanao del Norte.

On 27 June 2020, the NPA and the military engaged in a 30-minute firefight in Barangay De Vera, Donsol, Sorsogon. There were no reported casualties on either side, though the military reported retrieving weapons from the rebels.

On 27 June 2020, a police officer was shot dead by suspected armed drug suspects in Barangay Del Carmen, Iligan, Lanao del Norte. Authorities said the slain police officer had been involved in anti-drug operations. The police officer was driving on his way home when attacked and is assumed off-duty.

On 28 June 2020, a suspected NPA militant was shot dead during a firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Piwan, Midsalip, Zamboanga del Sur. The military also reported retrieving weapons from the rebels.

On 28 June 2020, two civilians were shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay 175, Caloocan. Reports indicate that it was a case of mistaken identity, as the assailants were reportedly looking for a drug suspect related to the two slain civilians.

source: ABS CBN; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Tempo (Philippines)
notes: On 28 June 2020, a drug suspect was killed while another escaped during a police raid in Barangay Wawa, Siniloan, Laguna (Barangay Acevida in some reports). Police said they recovered shabu (crystal meth) from the slain suspect, who they reported to be on the town's drug watchlist and to be the leader of a crime group.
On 28 June 2020, the military recovered anti-personnel mines planted by suspected NPA militants in Barangay Lower Olave, Buenavista, Agusan del Norte, following tips from locals.
On 29 June 2020, a government soldier was wounded during a 15-minute firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Lalud, Don Victoriano Chiongbian, Misamis Occidental.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Peace and Security Officer
notes: On 29 June 2020, a police officer was killed while three others - another police officer, a barangay watchman, and a barangay health worker - were wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Poblacion, Esperanza, Sultan Kudarat. The casualties were manning a COVID-19 (coronavirus) quarantine checkpoint. The assailants were reportedly flagged at the checkpoint and were unable to present the proper papers. The motive for the attack was unclear.

source: Rappler; Philippine Daily Inquirer; ABS CBN; GMA News
notes: On 29 June 2020, four soldiers assigned to do intelligence work were shot dead by a police team in Barangay Walled City, Jolo, Sulu. The national military and police leadership dispute the details of the event, with the police calling the incident a 'misencounter' and the military calling it 'murder' and a 'rubout,' saying the soldiers were attacked without provocation. The military and police have called for an impartial probe on the incident. The police officers involved were later disarmed and the police leadership of Sulu was fired.

On 29 June 2020, a suspected NPA militant was shot dead during a 15-minute firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Dalije, Miagao, Iloilo. Police also reported retrieving weapons and other items from the rebels.

assoc_actor_1: BAYAN: Bagong Alyansang Makabayan; KARAPATAN: Alliance for the Advancement of People's Rights
notes: On 30 June 2020, activist and human rights groups such as BAYAN and KARAPATAN staged a demonstration at the Commission on Human Rights grounds in Quezon City in order to condemn the different policies of the Duterte administration on its fourth anniversary. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Government of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 30 June 2020, a barangay councilor who was also a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Citrus, San Jose del Monte, Bulacan. The barangay councilor and another official, who was also wounded, were manning a COVID-19 quarantine checkpoint when attacked. The motive for the attack was unclear, though police said the slain councilor had already been arrested in 2016 for involvement in illegal drugs.

source: Tempo (Philippines); Philippine Daily Inquirer; ABS CBN; Philippine News Agency; Sunstar (Philippines)
notes: On 30 June 2020, a government soldier was killed during an encounter with the NPA in Barangay Luz, Guihulngan, Negros Oriental. The NPA's Special Partisan Unit (SPARU) was reportedly deployed to carry out the attack.
